string_ord_at: You can use this function to return a specific character code at a specific position within a string, with the index starting at 1 for the first character. If no character is found or the string is shorter than the value given to index, -1 is returned.
The position to get the character code from.
This will get the character code for the seventh character (where "H" counts as the first) in string "str" and store it in the variable "char_code".
